main_definition: To manage, organize or oversee the implementation of policies, procedures, or treatments.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To give (a medication or treatment) to someone in a professional capacity by following established guidelines and protocols.
meanings_and_examples.example: The nurse administered the prescribed dose of insulin to the patient.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To carry out, execute, or perform (an action, plan, or course of action) according to a set schedule or order.
meanings_and_examples.example: The project manager administered the new software update across all company computers on Monday morning.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To distribute responsibilities among team members in an organization effectively and efficiently, ensuring smooth functioning of operations.
meanings_and_examples.example: As a department head, it was my role to administer tasks fairly among the staff, delegating according to each member's strengths.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To govern or control (a governmental body) by enforcing laws and regulations.
meanings_and_examples.example: The local council members worked together to administer public services such as waste collection and road maintenance.
